summary: This document is an email from whistleblower Christopher J Dilorio to an SEC official named Janey, appealing a preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application related to Knight Capital. Dilorio alleges extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and cover-ups of financial fraud involving multiple entities and individuals, including connections to Net Element, money laundering, and market manipulation.

persons.name: Christopher J Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email, appealing the SEC's preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application and alleging extensive SEC corruption and obstruction in investigating financial fraud.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: SEC recipient of Dilorio's email, accused of failing to produce the record for his whistleblower award determination and being part of the obstruction.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: SEC official mentioned as a recipient of Dilorio's emails and part of the alleged obstruction of his whistleblower claims.

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: Referred to as SEC Chair with alleged undisclosed conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell, Jared Fishman, and Knight Capital (NITE), and accused of facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Described as a Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Chair Clayton who played a key role in keeping the criminal entity NITE/VIRT operational.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Alleged bag man involved with Hanover/Magna and multiple shell companies (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH), mentioned in an SEC complaint.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged bag man involved with JMJ, barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor' in 2013, and later involved with Blink Charging (fka New Image Concepts).

persons.name: Crede
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Net Element fraud, Esousa, Cobblestone, and potentially funding pump-and-dump research.

persons.name: Peizer
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Net Element fraud, Esousa, Cobblestone, and potentially funding pump-and-dump research.

persons.name: Milken
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Net Element fraud and related entities Esousa and Cobblestone.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThruEquity, LLC, named as a defendant in an SEC complaint (2018) for pump-and-dump promotion of Net Element.

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThruEquity, LLC, named as a defendant in an SEC complaint (2018) for pump-and-dump promotion of Net Element.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: SEC official mentioned as being in possession of Dilorio's 2013 TCR filed with Berger.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: SEC official with whom Dilorio filed a 2013 TCR.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower appealing to SEC official Janey regarding the denial of his award application, accusing Janey of obstruction.
Dilorio has sent hundreds of emails to Hoecker and other SEC officials as part of his whistleblower claims, alleging Hoecker is part of the obstruction.
Clayton and Fishman are colleagues from Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman allegedly played a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT operational.
Both are described as 'bag men' involved in money laundering shells and fraudulent financial activities, though not directly linked to each other in this document.
Mentioned together in connection with Net Element fraud, Esousa, Cobblestone, and potentially funding pump-and-dump research.
Brothers who co-founded SeeThruEquity, LLC, both named as defendants in an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump promotion.

events.title: Formal Appeal Submission
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sent a formal appeal for the preliminary denial of his covered action 2015-016 related to Knight Capital TCR, summarizing hundreds of previous emails.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThruEquity
events.description: The SEC brought a complaint against SeeThruEquity, LLC, Ajay Tandon, and Amit Tandon for pump-and-dump promotion of Net Element.

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for inadequate anti-money laundering programs and other violations.

events.title: SEC Shell Factory Complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint (Jaclin et al) against a 'shell factory' operation, which included New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging).

events.title: Allegations of Ongoing SEC Fraud
events.description: Dilorio alleges that as of June 30, 2020, NITE/VIRT is insolvent due to SEC-facilitated fraud, and the SEC continues to obstruct and mislead the public.

keyFacts: Christopher Dilorio alleges the SEC issued a fabricated preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application and failed to produce the required record of his hundreds of emails.
Dilorio claims the SEC is covering up massive fraud involving Net Element, including money laundering connections to WireCard, Putin, Rakishev, Trump, Kushner, Alfa, and others.

The SEC is accused of facilitating fraud by allowing Net Element to conduct fraudulent public offerings via Esousa and Cobblestone (linked to Crede/Peizer/Milken) and a reverse split to maintain its NASDAQ listing.
Dilorio references an SEC complaint from November 8, 2018, against SeeThruEquity and the Tandon brothers for pump-and-dump promotion of Net Element, which he claims validates his allegations.

The email alleges ongoing SEC corruption under Chair Clayton, who is accused of undisclosed conflicts with Sullivan & Cromwell and Jared Fishman, actively facilitating the criminal enterprise Knight/KCG/VIRT (NITE).
